meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices maximalism.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer was a true maximalist, always adding more and more decorations to every room.
meanings.sent2: As a maximalist, she believed that more is always better when it comes to home decor.
meanings.sent3: The maximalist went overboard with her collection of knick-knacks, turning her house into a museum.
meanings.sent4: Her maximalist approach to fashion made her stand out in a crowd, like a walking art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The maximalist's love for bold colors and patterns was evident in every aspect of her life.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a style or movement in art, literature, or music that is characterized by an excessive use of detail or ornamentation.
meanings.sent1: The maximalist painting was filled with intricate patterns and vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: Her maximalist approach to writing included elaborate descriptions and flowery language.
meanings.sent3: The maximalist cake was adorned with so many decorations that it looked more like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The maximalist garden was a riot of colors and shapes, like a living masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: His maximalist music compositions were a symphony of sounds, overwhelming the senses with richness.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive or exaggerated approach.
meanings.sent1: Her maximalist personality meant that she always went above and beyond in everything she did.
meanings.sent2: The maximalist marketing campaign bombarded customers with flashy ads and promotions.
meanings.sent3: His maximalist storytelling style often left listeners incredulous at the unbelievable twists.
meanings.sent4: The maximalist use of spices in the dish created an explosion of flavors in every bite.
meanings.sent5: The maximalist approach to problem-solving involved exploring every possible solution, no matter how outlandish.
